Package FrontEnd.Login

Class LoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrontEnd.Login.LoginController

  • public class LoginController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a controller for log-in window. In this window a user can log in to an existing account or create a new one. This also detects an admin login.

    • Method Detail

      • showAccountCreationDialog

        public void showAccountCreationDialog​()
        Clickable text "Create account" runs this method. It set disable(false) on all objects that were there.

      • signIn

        public void signIn​()
        Sign in logic (Button)

      • launchAdminDialog

        private void launchAdminDialog​()
        launches a new window (portal or admin prompt) with stage and hides the login window.

      • createAccount

        public void createAccount​()
        Creates a new account with given information. Starts complaining if some of the required fields were empty.

      • authenticationSucceeded

        private boolean authenticationSucceeded​(java.lang.String email,
                                        java.lang.String plaintextPass)
        Sends a plaintext password to backend. Crypting is done in backend.
        Parameters:
        email - email address (key value)
        plaintextPass - Password as plaintext. Crypting in backend
        Returns:
        returns true if auth succeeded

      • launchPortal

        public void launchPortal​(java.lang.String email,
                         boolean debug)
        This badboy launches the actual portal. If admin login is detected, launch admin prompt first
        Parameters:
        email - email field to launch portal with
        debug - debug mode for testing purposes

      • getAuthenticatedUser

        public static java.lang.String getAuthenticatedUser​()
        Getter for user email that succeeded login
        Returns:
        user email

      • setAuthenticatedUser

        public void setAuthenticatedUser​(java.lang.String email)
        Used for debug purposes to force the authenticated user
        Parameters:
        email - user to be set as authenticated

      • getDbmanager

        public static DatabaseManager getDbmanager​()
        Returns the databasemanager so it does not need to be initialized every time.
        Returns:
        databasemanager used in loginController
